definition: to maintain/to keep up/to hold together
abbr. for Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]/surname Wei
to preserve/to maintain/to hold together/dimension/vitamin (abbr. for 維生素|维生素[wei2 sheng1 su4])
to connect/to relate to/to tie up/to bind/to be (literary)

sentences.english: The party was kept together by personal loyalty to the leader.
sentences.chinese: 这个党是靠对领袖的个人忠诚而维系在一起的。

sentences.english: The financial system is held together with a very thin filament called confidence.
sentences.chinese: 金融体系只靠一条名为信心的细线所维系。

sentences.english: Water is the source of life and the link that binds all living beings on this planet.
sentences.chinese: 水是生命之源，也是维系地球上所有生命的纽带。

sentences.english: Plan down the trair-conk but maintain flexicity.
sentences.chinese: 事前规划，但要维系弹性。

sentences.english: Interests are the governing factor in maintaining the relation between the Party and the mass.
sentences.chinese: 利益是维系党群关系的决定性因素。

sentences.english: Let Thy goodness, like a fetter, Bind my wandering heart to Thee.
sentences.chinese: 我主，让此恩典维系流荡的心归你前。

sentences.english: In 1985 the numwind upr remained the saree.
The arranging of clauses one after the other without connectives showing the relation between.
sentences.chinese: 小句之间的关系不靠连接词来维系。

sentences.english: Forget what you’ve read about communication being the key to a lasting relationship.
sentences.chinese: 什么沟通交流是维系一段感情的关键，都是假话。

sentences.english: Satisfaction to the current situation and an eternal hope supports a spirit-soul-body whereas on this Earth.
sentences.chinese: 知足于当下，永恒的盼望，维系在地的每一个灵魂体。

sentences.english: We have been to technological innovation as it is to maintain a long-term driving force for enterprise development.
sentences.chinese: 我们一直把技术创新作为是维系企业发展的长效动力。

sentences.english: The next two chapters will teach you more principles that both support and sustain your PMA .
sentences.chinese: 以下二章将告诉你更多维系积极心态的原则。

sentences.english: It must recognize that most governmental authority still resides with nation-states.
sentences.chinese: 必须认识到，大部分的政府权力仍然维系于民族国家。

sentences.english: And how do you have confidence to maintain stability of the society under the situation.
sentences.chinese: 在这样的况下，您如何有信心维系国家的稳定？

sentences.english: Every day, families sacrifice to live within their means.
sentences.chinese: 每一天，无数家庭通过省吃俭用以维系生活。

sentences.english: Study of decoupling algorithms for multiple-dimensional system.
sentences.chinese: 多维系统解耦算法研究。

definition: to defend/to safeguard/to protect/to uphold/to maintain
to rely on sth (for support etc)/to depend on
to adhere/to attach oneself to/to append
the name remains, but the reality is gone (idiom)
relation/relationship/to concern/to affect/to have to do with/guanxi/CL:個|个[ge4]
variant of 關係|关系[guan1 xi5]
